title: Visual TrueType
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20140815070716/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Tools](http://web.archive.org/web/20140815070716/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tools) : [Type Design Tools](http://web.archive.org/web/20140815070716/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Type%20Design%20Tools) : Visual TrueType (VTT)**

Expert's font tool from Microsoft for dealing with the low level software language of editing [hinting](http://web.archive.org/web/20140815070716/http:/typophile.com/wiki/hinting) information for [TrueType](http://web.archive.org/web/20140815070716/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TrueType) fonts, and [OpenType](http://web.archive.org/web/20140815070716/http:/typophile.com/wiki/OpenType) fonts using TrueType outlines ( [Quadratic Bezier](http://web.archive.org/web/20140815070716/http:/graphics.cs.ucdavis.edu/GraphicsNotes/Quadratic-Bezier-Curves/Quadratic-Bezier-Curves.html)) for the glyphs. The program itself is friendly enough, but [TrueType hints](http://web.archive.org/web/20140815070716/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TrueType%20hints) are encoded in their own stack-based programming language -- as complicated as the language used to describe font outlines themselves -- and the GUI can go only so far to mask the complexity and power of the hints.

Originally designed by the architect of the TrueType font format, [Sampo Kaasila](http://web.archive.org/web/20140815070716/http:/www.typesolutions.com/). Released as 'TypeMan' for the Macintosh. Completely rewritten by Beat Stamm of Microsoft Typography and released for both Windows and the Macintosh.

Available from [Microsoft Typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20140815070716/http:/www.microsoft.com/typography/tools/vtt.aspx) upon completion of an application. Both Windows and Mac OS are supported.
author: vinceconnare
